properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 9:54PM EST until February 11 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended
the

* Flood Advisory for...
West central Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North
Carolina...
Southeastern Gaston County in the Piedmont of North Carolina...

* Until 915 AM EST Tuesday.

* At 915 PM EST, Widespread rainfall accumulations of 3-5 inches
between February 5 and February 7 over the entire Catawba River
watershed has caused high flows and elevated lake levels along the
Catawba River reservoir chain. As the excess water is passed
through each lake project downstream, significant pool rises have
occurred at the middle Catawba River lakes, especially at
Mountain Island Lake, where the pool is above the full pool of
100.0 feet. This is causing nuisance shoreline flooding and
flooding of lake-access areas, campgrounds, docks, and residential
yards.

* As water spills over Mountain Island Dam, high flows are causing
rises just downstream of the dam along the Catawba River. Based on
current pool elevations, nuisance flooding of low-lying areas
adjacent to the river can be expected to persist through tonight
or while the pool at Mountain Island Lake remains at or above
101.5 feet.

* Additional rainfall is expected tonight through Tuesday across the
Catawba River watershed.  Rainfall totals of 1-3" are forecasted
through Tuesday afternoon, and this rainfall will result in
additional flow that will need to be passed through the Catawba
reservoir system.  With the pool at Lake Norman near 99 feet, this
additional water may require additional releases at Cowans Ford Dam,
which will result in additional rises and more significant flooding
at Mountain Island Lake and the Catawba River immediately downstream
of the dam.

* The following reservoir is experiencing Action/Advisory Stage
pool elevations:

Mountain Island Lake.
CURRENT Pool Elevation: 101.59 feet and nearly steady.

FORECAST: Duke Energy projects the pool will exceed 102 feet
Tuesday morning and potentially exceed 103.5 feet later Tuesday if
the forecasted rainfall occurs.

ACTION/ADVISORY Stage: 101.5 feet.
MINOR Flood Stage: 103.0 feet.

IMPACTS: At 101.5 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. Nuisance flooding of
low-lying areas including residential yards, docks, and boat-launch
areas is ongoing.  Flooding of residential yards downstream of
Mountain Island Dam along Riverhaven Dr, Hart Rd, Lake Dr, and
Riverside Dr is beginning.

At 103.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Significant inundation of
low-lying areas is ongoing around Mountain Island Lake and downstream
of the dam along/near Riverside Dr. Some outbuilding inundation may
begin.

* Residents should take immediate actions to protect property
adjacent to Mountain Island Lake and the Catawba River, closely
monitor lake levels for sudden changes, and follow guidance from
Charlotte-Mecklenburg Emergency Management. Drivers are encouraged
to heed any barricades and avoid all flooded areas.

* For more information on lake levels or dam releases, people are
encouraged to visit http://lakes.duke-energy.com or call 1-800-829-
5253.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is
harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
